DATS« December 31, 1953
Just received this word from Jim Morris. Can you tall me if I can refer to Cohn &
Marks and ask their help? 1 would at onoe, but not sure bow much work we should
toss at them under terms of your last meeting with them. Hope we get them
lined up to help.
Dear Harry*
KQAC has received word that a Lewiston, Idaho, applicant has filed for 550 kilo¬
cycles in that city. Such a commercial station on SOAC - s frequency would pose a
serious threat to our audience east of the Cascade Mountains. Katurally we will
oppose the application and attempt to protect our listening audience against such
interference.
This letter is to seek your suggestions and advice as m begin to prepare our
case. Can the H.A.B.B. assist xm in protecting KOAC? So far the plans have not
been formulated here but we will probably come up with some sort of committee
representing the three interested administrative groupst the Chancellor" s office,
General Extension Division (responsible for programs) and Oregon State College
(the actual licensee). Actual steps toward protesting the Lewiston application
will probably come out of some such group here.
If you have suggestions for me I'll be glad to pass them along to the admini-
stratlon as we plan the protest. Right now I'm in the prooess of summarizing
the unique program services which HOAG makes available to the audience and which
would be lost to the people in the area of interference. In addition, we know
we can harness the support of the county agents in the area, as well as those
folks who are now on our mailing list as listeners In the area.
We will sincerely appreciate any help you can gise us.
Happy Hew Year2
James K, Morris
